explanation: The stage direction describes the setting of the play, specifically the environment (a pleasant countryside near the Baron's house) and the time of day (at the end of the day). It does not describe any character actions, movements, entrances, exits, interactions, or other elements that fall under the other categories.
stgdir: Le théâtre représente une campagne agréable voisine de la maison du Baron : la scène est au déclin du jour.
